location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the resource at the time the operation was called

environment.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the environment that the application is linked to

appPort.description: The Dapr appPort. Specifies the internal listening port for the application to handle requests from the Dapr sidecar.

appId.description: The Dapr appId. Specifies the identifier used by Dapr for service invocation.

config.description: Specifies the Dapr configuration to use for the resource.

annotations.description: Annotations to be applied to the Kubernetes resources output by the resource

labels.description: Labels to be applied to the Kubernetes resources output by the resource

namespace.description: The namespace of the application environment.

recipe.description: Recipe status at deployment time for a resource.

resourceId.description: The resource id of the compute resource for application environment.

identity.description: IdentitySettings is the external identity setting.

kind.description: IdentitySettingKind is the kind of supported external identity setting

oidcIssuer.description: The URI for your compute platform's OIDC issuer

resource.description: The resource ID of the provisioned identity

namespace.description: The namespace to use for the environment.

templateKind.description: TemplateKind is the kind of the recipe template used by the portable resource upon deployment.

templatePath.description: TemplatePath is the path of the recipe consumed by the portable resource upon deployment.

templateVersion.description: TemplateVersion is the version number of the template.

localId.description: The logical identifier scoped to the owning Radius resource. This is only needed or used when a resource has a dependency relationship. LocalIDs do not have any particular format or meaning beyond being compared to determine dependency relationships.

id.description: The UCP resource ID of the underlying resource.

radiusManaged.description: Determines whether Radius manages the lifecycle of the underlying resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

environment.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the environment that the application is linked to

application.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the application

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the resource at the time the operation was called

connections.description: Specifies a connection to another resource.

identity.description: IdentitySettings is the external identity setting.

resourceProvisioning.description: Specifies how the underlying service/resource is provisioned and managed. Available values are 'internal', where Radius manages the lifecycle of the resource internally, and 'manual', where a user manages the resource.

resources.description: A collection of references to resources associated with the container

image.description: The registry and image to download and run in your container

imagePullPolicy.description: The image pull policy for the container

command.description: Entrypoint array. Overrides the container image's ENTRYPOINT

args.description: Arguments to the entrypoint. Overrides the container image's CMD

value.description: The value of the environment variable

secretRef.description: This secret is used within a recipe. Secrets are encrypted, often have fine-grained access control, auditing and are recommended to be used to hold sensitive data.

source.description: The ID of an Applications.Core/SecretStore resource containing sensitive data required for recipe execution.

key.description: The key for the secret in the secret store.

protocol.description: The protocol in use by the port

scheme.description: Specifies the URL scheme of the communication protocol. Consumers can use the scheme to construct a URL. The value defaults to 'http' or 'https' depending on the port value

port.description: Specifies the port that will be exposed by this container. Must be set when value different from containerPort is desired

initialDelaySeconds.description: Initial delay in seconds before probing for readiness/liveness

failureThreshold.description: Threshold number of times the probe fails after which a failure would be reported

periodSeconds.description: Interval for the readiness/liveness probe in seconds

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the readiness/liveness probe times out. Defaults to 5 seconds

command.description: Command to execute to probe readiness/liveness

path.description: The route to make the HTTP request on

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to add to the get request

mountPath.description: The path where the volume is mounted

managedStore.description: The managed store for the ephemeral volume

kind.description: The kind of IAM provider to configure

roles.description: RBAC permissions to be assigned on the source resource

id.description: Resource id of an existing resource

kubernetes.description: The runtime configuration properties for Kubernetes

base.description: The serialized YAML manifest which represents the base Kubernetes resources to deploy, such as Deployment, Service, ServiceAccount, Secrets, and ConfigMaps.

pod.description: A strategic merge patch that will be applied to the PodSpec object when this container is being deployed.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the resource at the time the operation was called

recipes.description: Specifies Recipes linked to the Environment.

recipeConfig.description: Configuration for Recipes. Defines how each type of Recipe should be configured and run.

scope.description: Target scope for Azure resources to be deployed into.  For example: '/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/testGroup'.
Target scope for AWS resources to be deployed into.  For example: '/planes/aws/aws/accounts/000000000000/regions/us-west-2'.

templatePath.description: Path to the template provided by the recipe. Currently only link to Azure Container Registry is supported.

plainHttp.description: Connect to the Bicep registry using HTTP (not-HTTPS). This should be used when the registry is known not to support HTTPS, for example in a locally-hosted registry. Defaults to false (use HTTPS/TLS).

templateVersion.description: Version of the template to deploy. For Terraform recipes using a module registry this is required, but must be omitted for other module sources.

terraform.description: Configuration for Terraform Recipes. Controls how Terraform plans and applies templates as part of Recipe deployment.

env.description: The environment variables injected during Terraform Recipe execution for the recipes in the environment.

envSecrets.description: Environment variables containing sensitive information can be stored as secrets. The secrets are stored in Applications.Core/SecretStores resource.

authentication.description: Authentication information used to access private Terraform module sources. Supported module sources: Git.

providers.description: Configuration for Terraform Recipe Providers. Controls how Terraform interacts with cloud providers, SaaS providers, and other APIs. For more information, please see: https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/providers/configuration.

git.description: Authentication information used to access private Terraform modules from Git repository sources.

pat.description: Personal Access Token (PAT) configuration used to authenticate to Git platforms.

secret.description: The ID of an Applications.Core/SecretStore resource containing the Git platform personal access token (PAT). The secret store must have a secret named 'pat', containing the PAT value. A secret named 'username' is optional, containing the username associated with the pat. By default no username is specified.

secrets.description: Sensitive data in provider configuration can be stored as secrets. The secrets are stored in Applications.Core/SecretStores resource.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

environment.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the environment that the portable resource is linked to

application.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the application that the portable resource is consumed by (if applicable)

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the resource at the time the operation was called

recipe.description: The recipe used to automatically deploy underlying infrastructure for a portable resource

resourceProvisioning.description: Specifies how the underlying service/resource is provisioned and managed. Available values are 'recipe', where Radius manages the lifecycle of the resource through a Recipe, and 'manual', where a user manages the resource and provides the values.

name.description: The name of the recipe within the environment to use

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

environment.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the environment that the application is linked to

application.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the application

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the resource at the time the operation was called

internal.description: Sets Gateway to not be exposed externally (no public IP address associated). Defaults to false (exposed to internet).

hostname.description: Declare hostname information for the Gateway. Leaving the hostname empty auto-assigns one: mygateway.myapp.PUBLICHOSTNAMEORIP.nip.io.

tls.description: TLS configuration definition for Gateway resource.

url.description: URL of the gateway resource. Readonly

prefix.description: Specify a prefix for the hostname: myhostname.myapp.PUBLICHOSTNAMEORIP.nip.io. Mutually exclusive with 'fullyQualifiedHostname' and will be overridden if both are defined.

fullyQualifiedHostname.description: Specify a fully-qualified domain name: myapp.mydomain.com. Mutually exclusive with 'prefix' and will take priority if both are defined.

path.description: The path to match the incoming request path on. Ex - /myservice.

destination.description: The URL or id of the service to route to. Ex - 'http://myservice'.

replacePrefix.description: Optionally update the prefix when sending the request to the service. Ex - replacePrefix: '/' and path: '/myservice' will transform '/myservice/myroute' to '/myroute'

enableWebsockets.description: Enables websocket support for the route. Defaults to false.

sslPassthrough.description: If true, gateway lets the https traffic sslPassthrough to the backend servers for decryption.

minimumProtocolVersion.description: Tls Minimum versions for Gateway resource.

certificateFrom.description: The resource id for the secret containing the TLS certificate and key for the gateway.

application.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the application

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the resource at the time the operation was called

data.description: An object to represent key-value type secrets

resource.description: The resource id of external secret store.

name.description: The name of the referenced secret.

version.description: The version of the referenced secret.

certificates.description: The KeyVault certificates that this volume exposes

keys.description: The KeyVault keys that this volume exposes

resource.description: The ID of the keyvault to use for this volume resource

secrets.description: The KeyVault secrets that this volume exposes

alias.description: File name when written to disk
